thread.title: Jubilation as woman removes veil & stomps on it after escaping ISIS before it's set ALIGHT
thread.title_full: Jubilation as woman removes veil & stomps on it after escaping ISIS before it's set ALIGHT

title: Jubilation as woman removes veil & stomps on it after escaping ISIS before it's set ALIGHT
text:
What some ppl don't understand [is], a lot of women CHOOSE to wear it Twitter user @Enjoyitdummy 
Twitter users have since spoken out in support of the women. 
“This is a beautiful sight! The only Globalist effort that should have priority is destroying EVIL & promoting JOY like this,” said @Brainykid2010, while @AronKambey added: “Brave woman.” 
Responding to those criticising the use of the face veil, @Enjoyitdummy said: “What some ppl don't understand [is], a lot of women CHOOSE to wear it. Respect their choice & support both sides.” Meet the ex-Guantanamo ISIS suicide bomber Wed, February 22, 2017 An Islamic State (ISIS) suicide bomber has been named as a British ex-Guantanamo detainee who was reportedly handed £1million in compensation from the Government. Twitter 1 of 5 The depraved terror group released a photo of what is is believed to be Ronald Fiddler, known as Abu Zakariya al-Britani , who detonated a car bomb at an Iraqi army base near the Iraqi city of Mosul. TWITTER/RUDAW ENGLISH Women were seen smoking and men later danced in celebration 
The video comes in the same week Iraqi forces obliterated Islamic State terrorists in the outskirts of Mosul . 
The Iraqi troops blasted the village of Abu Sayyaf, which overlooks Mosul, as they close in on regaining the city. 
Government forces have now begun their assault to reclaim the whole city after Iraq’s ministry of defence deployed air jets to drop leaflets across western Mosul to warn residents of the imminent battles. 
The footage also comes after an ISIS jihadi boasted about raping more than 200 Iraqi women and called it “normal”. 
Amar Hussein said “young men need this. This is normal” during an interview after he had been captured by Kurdish forces during an assault on the city of Kirkuk in October that killed 99 civilians. Related articles
